comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Possibly this guy: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Willett,_Jr. If so, another site says he bought his way onto the NY Supreme Court, and was convicted of it in 1914: politicalgraveyard.com/trouble/1910-1919.html

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Willett, an ex-Congressman, was tried, convicted and sentenced to Sing Sing prison for not more than a year and a half, and not less than one year, plus a fine of a thousand dollars (convertible to a thousand additional days, if unpaid.) Here's the story in the New York Times, February 5, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9902E5D71F3BE6...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Willett,_Jr. I fixed the link, Flickr doesn't handle a terminal period properly.
